messages.content: What is the purpose of the GNU General Public License?
The GNU General Public License is intended to guarantee the freedom to share and change all versions of a program to ensure it remains free software for all users.
What does the GPL grant users the right to do with the software?
The GPL grants users the right to freely copy, distribute and modify the software.
Does the GPL allow charging for software distributed under its terms?
Yes, the GPL allows charging for software distributed under its terms, but users must also be given access to its source code.
What is a covered work?
A covered work refers to either the unmodified Program or a work based on the Program.
What is the term for conveying a work under the License?
The term for conveying a work under the licenses is 'as long as your license otherwise remains in force.'
Is it true that distributing a program under the GPL type of licenses requires making the source code available?
Yes. According to the terms, if things like binary forms are distributed, they must also make available the source code.
What are the conditions that must be met in order to convey a modified source version of the work?
You must carry prominent notices stating that you modified it and the date, it is released under the License, and if it has interactive user interfaces, the legal notices must be displayed.
What is the difference between conveying and propagating?

Propagating means doing anything with the work that without permission would make you liable for infringement under copyright law. Conveying is a type of propagation that enables others to make or receive copies.
Does the GPL warranty or assume liability for the software?
No. The GPL disclaims all warranties and liabilities for the Program 'to the extent permitted by applicable law.'
Can you link the covered work with a work licensed under the GNU Affero General Public License?
Yes, the terms of this License will continue to apply to the part which is the covered work.
What is Comfy Couple?
Comfy Couple is a simple custom node for ComfyUI that helps generate images of actual couples more easily without blending their features.
How does Comfy Couple differ from attention-couple-ComfyUI?
Comfy Couple is a fork of attention-couple-ComfyUI that replaces mask magic with a comfy shortcut, simplifying the workflow.
What are the steps to install Comfy Couple?
To install Comfy Couple, change the directory to custom nodes of ComfyUI, clone the ComfyUI-ComfyCouple repository, and restart ComfyUI.
How do you use Comfy Couple in a workflow?

To use Comfy Couple, right-click in the workflow, choose the 'loaders â†’ Comfy Couple' node, connect inputs and outputs, and provide two positive prompts for the left and right sides of the image, respectively.
What is a known issue with Comfy Couple?
Comfy Couple is not quite actual regional prompting.
Who are some of the contributors credited for Comfy Couple?

Some of the contributors credited for Comfy Couple include @laksjdjf for the original repo, @pythongosssss for ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, @Meina for the MeinaMix V11 model used in the example, and @Numeratic for the Genshin Impact All In One model used in the example.
Where can you find an example workflow for Comfy Couple?
An example workflow for Comfy Couple can be found in the workflows folder of the repository, specifically at workflows/workflow-comfy-couple.json.
